title: Authors and Citation
text: Sergej Potapov. Author. Werner Adler. Author. Matthias Schmid. Author. Frederic Bertrand. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sergej Potapov, Werner Adler, Matthias Schmid Frederic Bertrand (2025). Estimators Prediction Accuracy Time--Event Data, R package version 1.4-0. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.survAUC.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data},   author = {Sergej Potapov and Werner Adler and Matthias Schmid and Frederic Bertrand},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.4-0},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=survAUC},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.survAUC}, }

title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: https://doi.org/10.32614/CRAN.package.survAUC goal survAUC provide variety functions estimate time-dependent true/false positive rates AUC curves set censored survival data.

title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: can install released version survAUC CRAN : development version GitHub : alternatively
code: install.packages("survAUC") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("fbertran/survAUC") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("fbertran/survAUC")

title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Retrieve example dataset, split train (TR) test (TE) set. train model train set derive predictions train (lp Surv.rsp) test (lpnew Surv.rsp.new).
code: library(survAUC) data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat)  times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)

what: Chambless and Diao’s estimator of cumulative/dynamic AUC for right-censored time-to-event data
title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed Section 3.3 Chambless Diao (2006). contrast general form Chambless Diao’s estimator, AUC.cd restricted Cox regression. Specifically, assumed lp lpnew predictors Cox proportional hazards model. Estimates obtained AUC.cd valid long Cox model specified correctly. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0,max(times)][0,max(\textrm{times})] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). plot chunk unnamed-chunk-8

what: Hung and Chiang’s estimator of cumulative/dynamic AUC for right-censored time-to-event data
title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed Hung Chiang (2010).  estimator based inverse-probability--censoring weights assume specific working model deriving predictor lpnew. assumed, however, one--one relationship predictor expected survival times conditional predictor. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0,max(times)][0, max(\textrm{times})] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). plot chunk unnamed-chunk-10
code: AUC_hc <- AUC.hc(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew, times) AUC_hc$iAUC #> NULL plot(AUC_hc)

what: Song and Zhou’s estimators of AUC for right-censored time-to-event data
title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: sens.sh spec.sh functions implement estimators time-dependent true false positive rates proposed Song Zhou (2008). AUC.sh function implements estimators cumulative/dynamic incident/dynamic AUC proposed Song Zhou (2008). estimators given areas time-dependent ROC curves estimated sens.sh spec.sh. case cumulative/dynamic AUC, iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0,max(times)][0,max(\textrm{times})] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). case incident/dynamic AUC, iauc given integral AUC [0,max(times)][0, max(\textrm{times})] (weighted 2 times product estimated probability density estimated survival function time--event outcome). plot chunk unnamed-chunk-12
code: lp <- predict(train.fit) AUC_sh <- AUC.sh(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) names(AUC_sh) #> [1] "auc"   "times" "iauc" AUC_sh$iauc #> [1] 0.8430845 plot(AUC_sh)

what: Uno’s estimator of cumulative/dynamic AUC for right-censored time-to-event data
title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: sens.uno spec.uno functions implement estimators time-dependent true false positive rates proposed Section 5.1 Uno et al. (2007). AUC.uno function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC based TPR FPR estimators proposed Uno et al. (2007). given area(s) time-dependent ROC curve(s) estimated sens.uno spec.uno. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0,max(times)][0, max(\textrm{times})] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). plot chunk unnamed-chunk-14
code: AUC_Uno <- AUC.uno(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew, times) names(AUC_Uno) #> [1] "auc"   "times" "iauc" AUC_Uno$iauc #> [1] 0.7552083 plot(AUC_Uno)

what: Censoring-adjusted C-statistic by Uno et al.
title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: UnoC function implements censoring-adjusted C-statistic proposed Uno et al. (2011). interpretation Harrell’s C survival data (implemented rcorr.cens function Hmisc package).
code: Cstat <- UnoC(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew) Cstat #> [1] 0.7333333

title: Estimators of Prediction Accuracy for Time-to-Event Data
text: Chambless, L. E. G. Diao (2006). Estimation time-dependent area ROC curve long-term risk prediction. Statistics Medicine, 25, 3474-3486. Hung, H. C.-T. Chiang (2010). Estimation methods time-dependent AUC models survival data. Canadian Journal Statistics, 38, 8-26. Song, X. X.-H. Zhou (2008). semiparametric approach covariate specific ROC curve survival outcome. Statistica Sinica, 18, 947-965. Uno, H., T. Cai, L. Tian, L. J. Wei (2007). Evaluating prediction rules t-year survivors censored regression models. Journal American Statistical Association, 102, 527-537.

what: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
text: Chambless Diao's estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC right-censored   time--event data

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
code: AUC.cd(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new = NULL, lp, lpnew, times)

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed   Section 3.3 Chambless Diao (2006). contrast general form   Chambless Diao's estimator, AUC.cd restricted Cox regression.   Specifically, assumed lp lpnew predictors   Cox proportional hazards model. Estimates obtained   AUC.cd valid long Cox model specified correctly.   iauc summary measure given integral AUC   [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density   time--event outcome). Note recursive estimators proposed Sections 3.1 3.2   Chambless Diao (2006) implemented survAUC package.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
text: AUC.cd returns object class survAUC. Specifically,   AUC.cd returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic AUC estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
text: Chambless, L. E. G. Diao (2006).  Estimation time-dependent area ROC curve long-term risk prediction.Statistics Medicine 25, 3474–3486.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — AUC.cd
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                    AUC_CD <- AUC.cd(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times)

what: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
text: Hung Chiang's estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC right-censored   time--event data

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
code: AUC.hc(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew, times)

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed   Hung Chiang (2010). estimator based inverse-probability--censoring   weights assume specific working model deriving predictor   lpnew. assumed, however, one--one   relationship predictor expected survival times conditional   predictor. iauc summary measure given integral AUC   [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density   time--event outcome). Note estimator implemented AUC.hc restricted situations   random censoring assumption holds (formula (4) Hung Chiang 2010).

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
text: AUC.hc returns object class survAUC. Specifically,   AUC.hc returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic AUC estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc
text: Hung, H. C.-T. Chiang (2010).  Estimation methods time-dependent AUC models survival data.Canadian Journal Statistics 38, 8–26.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — AUC.hc

what: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
text: Song Zhou's estimators AUC right-censored time--event data

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
code: AUC.sh(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new=NULL, lp, lpnew, times,      type="incident", savesensspec=FALSE) sens.sh(Surv.rsp, lp, lpnew, times, type="incident") spec.sh(Surv.rsp, lp, lpnew, times)

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC. type string defining type true positive rate (TPR):               "incident" refers incident TPR ,               "cumulative" refers cumulative TPR. savesensspec logical specifying whether sensitivities specificities                       saved.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
text: sens.sh spec.sh functions implement estimators   time-dependent true false positive rates proposed Song Zhou (2008). AUC.sh function implements estimators cumulative/dynamic   incident/dynamic AUC proposed Song Zhou (2008). estimators given   areas time-dependent ROC curves estimated   sens.sh spec.sh. case cumulative/dynamic   AUC, iauc summary measure given integral AUC   [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density   time--event outcome). case incident/dynamic AUC, iauc   given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted 2 times   product estimated probability density estimated survival   function time--event outcome). results obtained spec.sh, spec.sh AUC.sh   valid long lp lpnew predictors   correctly specified Cox proportional hazards model. case,   estimators remain valid even censoring times depend values   predictors.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
text: AUC.sh returns object class survAUC. Specifically,   AUC.sh returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic incident/dynamic AUC estimates   (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC. sens.sh spec.sh return matrices dimensions times x   lpnew + 1. elements matrices sensitivity   specificity estimates threshold lpnew time point   specified times.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
text: Song, X. X.-H. Zhou (2008). semiparametric approach covariate specific ROC curve survival outcome.Statistica Sinica 18, 947–965.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — AUC.sh
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                    AUC_sh <- AUC.sh(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) names(AUC_sh) #> [1] "auc"   "times" "iauc"  AUC_sh$iauc #> [1] 0.8430845

what: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
text: C-statistic Begg et al.

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
code: BeggC(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew)

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data.

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
text: estimated C-statistic.

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
text: function implements C-statistic proposed Begg et al. (2000). interpretation Harrell's C survival data (implemented rcorr.cens function Hmisc package).  BeggC restricted Cox regression.  Specifically, assumed lp lpnew predictors Cox proportional hazards model. Estimates obtained BeggC valid long Cox model specified correctly.

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
text: Begg, B. C., L. D. Craemer, E. S. Venkatraman J. Rosai (2000).  Comparing tumor staging grading systems: case study review issues, using thymoma model.Statistics Medicine 19, 1997–2014.

title: C-statistic by Begg et al. — BeggC
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat)                Cstat <- BeggC(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew) Cstat #> [1] 0.6757624

what: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
text: Gonen Heller's Concordance Index Cox proportional hazards models

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
code: GHCI(lpnew)

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
text: lpnew vector predictors obtained test data.

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
text: length-one numeric vector containing concordance probability estimate.

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
text: function implements concordance probability estimator proposed Gonen Heller (2005). interpretation Harrell's C survival data (implemented rcorr.cens function Hmisc package). results obtained GHCI valid long lpnew predictor correctly specified Cox proportional hazards model. case, estimator remains valid even censoring times depend values predictor. Note smoothed version GHCI, proposed Section 3 Gonen Heller (2005), implemented R package survAUC.

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
text: Harrell, F. E., R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor, K. L. Lee R. . Rosati (1982).  Evaluating yield medical tests.Journal American Medical Association 247, 2543–2546. Harrell, F. E., K. L. Lee, R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor R. . Rosati (1984).  Regression modeling strategies improved prognostic prediction.Statistics Medicine 3, 143–152. Gonen, M. G. Heller (2005).  Concordance probability discriminatory power proportional hazards regression.Biometrika 92, 965–970.

title: Gonen and Heller's Concordance Index for Cox models — GHCI
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE)                   GHCI(lpnew) #> [1] 0.8515446

what: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: Compute summary measures time-dependent AUC curve

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
code: IntAUC(AUC, times, S, tmax, auc.type = "cumulative")

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: AUC vector AUCs. times vector time points corresponding AUC. S vector survival probabilities corresponding times. tmax number specifying upper limit time range compute summary measure. auc.type string defining type AUC. 'cumulative' refers cumulative/dynamic AUC, 'incident' refers incident/dynamic AUC.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: scalar number corresponding summary measure interest.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: function calculates integral time-dependent AUC curve (“IAUC” measure) using integration limits [0, tmax]. values AUC curve specified via AUC argument. case auc.type = "cumulative" (cumulative/dynamic IAUC), values AUC weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome. case auc.type = "incident" (incident/dynamic IAUC), values AUC weighted 2 times product estimated probability density (estimated) survival function time--event outcome.  survival function specified via S argument. shown Heagerty Zheng (2005), incident/dynamic version IAUC can interpreted global concordance index measuring probability observations large predictor value shorter survival time observations small predictor value. incident/dynamic version IAUC interpretation Harrell's C survival data.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: Harrell, F. E., R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor, K. L. Lee R. . Rosati (1982).  Evaluating yield medical tests.Journal American Medical Association 247, 2543–2546. Harrell, F. E., K. L. Lee, R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor R. . Rosati (1984).  Regression modeling strategies improved prognostic prediction.Statistics Medicine 3, 143–152. Heagerty, P. J. Y. Zheng (2005).  Survival model predictive accuracy ROC curves.Biometrics 61, 92–105.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                               x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                     AUC_CD <- AUC.cd(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) IntAUC(AUC_CD$auc, AUC_CD$times, runif(length(times),0,1), median(times), auc.type="cumulative") #> [1] 0.7857908

'cumulative' refers                   cumulative/dynamic AUC, 'incident' refers incident/dynamic                   AUC.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: function calculates integral time-dependent AUC curve (“IAUC”   measure) using integration limits [0, tmax]. values AUC curve   specified via AUC argument. case auc.type = "cumulative" (cumulative/dynamic IAUC), values   AUC weighted estimated probability density   time--event outcome. case auc.type = "incident" (incident/dynamic   IAUC), values AUC weighted 2 times product estimated   probability density (estimated) survival function time--event outcome.   survival function specified via S argument. shown Heagerty Zheng (2005), incident/dynamic version IAUC   can interpreted global concordance index measuring probability   observations large predictor value shorter survival time   observations small predictor value. incident/dynamic version IAUC   interpretation Harrell's C survival data.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: scalar number corresponding summary measure interest.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
text: Harrell, F. E., R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor, K. L. Lee R. . Rosati (1982).  Evaluating yield medical tests.Journal American Medical Association 247, 2543–2546. Harrell, F. E., K. L. Lee, R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor R. . Rosati (1984).  Regression modeling strategies improved prognostic prediction.Statistics Medicine 3, 143–152. Heagerty, P. J. Y. Zheng (2005).  Survival model predictive accuracy ROC curves.Biometrics 61, 92–105.

title: Integration of time-dependent AUC curves — IntAUC
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                               x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                     AUC_CD <- AUC.cd(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) IntAUC(AUC_CD$auc, AUC_CD$times, runif(length(times),0,1), median(times), auc.type="cumulative") #> [1] 0.7526518

what: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
text: R2-type Coefficients Cox proportional hazards models

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
code: OXS(Surv.rsp, lp, lp0)  Nagelk(Surv.rsp, lp, lp0)  XO(Surv.rsp, lp, lp0)

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors. lp0 vector predictors obtained covariate-free null model.

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
text: estimated R2 coefficient.

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
text: OXS, Nagelk XO functions implement three types R2 coefficients right-censored time--event data: () coefficient proposed O'Quigley et al. (2005) (OXS), (b) coefficient proposed Nagelkerke (1991) (Nagelk) (c) coefficient proposed Xu O'Quigley (1999) (XO). OXS, Nagelk XO functions assume lp lpnew derived correctly specified Cox proportional hazards model, estimates obtained functions valid Cox model holds.

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
text: Nagelkerke, N. J. D. (1991). note general definition coefficient determination.Biometrika 78, 691–692. O'Quigley, J., R. Xu, J. Stare (2005). Explained randomness proportional hazards models.Statistics Medicine 24, 479–489. Xu, R. J. O'Quigley (1999). measure dependence proportional hazards models.Journal Nonparametric Statistics 12, 83–107.

title: R2-type Coefficients for Cox proportional hazards models — R2_type_Coef
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  model0 <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat)~1, data=TR) model1 <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat)~age, data=TR) f0 <- rep(0,nrow(TE)) f1 <- predict(model1, newdata=TE)                Surv.res <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat)  OXS(Surv.res, f1, f0) #> [1] 0.4973804 Nagelk(Surv.res, f1, f0) #> [1] 0.2939943 XO(Surv.res, f1, f0) #> [1] 0.329469

what: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
text: Censoring-adjusted C-statistic Uno et al.

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
code: UnoC(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew, time = NULL)

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. time positive number restricting upper limit time range consideration.

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
text: estimated C-statistic.

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
text: function implements censoring-adjusted C-statistic proposed Uno et al. (2011). interpretation Harrell's C survival data (implemented rcorr.cens function Hmisc package). Uno's estimator based inverse-probability--censoring weights assume specific working model deriving predictor lpnew. assumed, however, one--one relationship predictor expected survival times conditional predictor. Note estimator implemented UnoC restricted situations random censoring assumption holds.

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
text: Harrell, F. E., R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor, K. L. Lee R. . Rosati (1982).  Evaluating yield medical tests.Journal American Medical Association 247, 2543–2546. Harrell, F. E., K. L. Lee, R. M. Califf, D. B. Pryor R. . Rosati (1984).  Regression modeling strategies improved prognostic prediction.Statistics Medicine 3, 143–152. Uno, H., T. Cai T, M. J. Pencina, R. B. D'Agostino W. L. Wei (2011).  C-statistics evaluating overall adequacy risk prediction procedures censored survival data.Statistics Medicine 30, 1105–1117.

title: C-statistic by Uno et al. — UnoC
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat)                Cstat <- UnoC(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew) Cstat #> [1] 0.7333333

what: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
title: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
text: Plot method survAUC survErr Objects

title: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
code: # S3 method for class 'survAUC' plot(   x,   col = "red",   type = "l",   ylim = c(0, 1),   xlab = "Time",   ylab = "AUC",   main = "Time-dependent AUC",   add = FALSE,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'survErr' plot(   x,   col = "red",   type = "l",   ylim = c(0, 1),   xlab = "Time",   ylab = "Prediction error",   main = "Time-dependent Prediction Error",   add = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
text: x object class survAUC. col color used draw AUC curve. type type plot drawn. See argument 'type' plot function. ylim y limits plot. xlab title x axis. See title. ylab title y axis. See title. main main title plot. See title. add logical specifying whether AUC-Curve added already existing plot. ... Graphics parameters can passed 'plot'.

title: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
text: Plot survAUC object generated functions AUC.uno, AUC.sh, AUC.cd, AUC.hc predErr.

title: Plot method for survAUC and survErr Objects — plot_survAUC_survErr
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 600, 10)                    AUC_sh <- AUC.sh(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) plot(AUC_sh) abline(h = 0.5)   BrierScore <- predErr(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times,                        type = "brier", int.type = "weighted") plot(BrierScore) abline(h = 0.25)

what: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
text: Inverse-probability--censoring weighted estimators absolute squared deviations survival functions

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
code: predErr(   Surv.rsp,   Surv.rsp.new,   lp,   lpnew,   times,   type = "brier",   int.type = "unweighted" )

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate prediction error curve. type string specifying type prediction error curve: 'brier' refers squared deviation predicted observed survival (Brier score), 'robust' refers absolute deviation predicted observed survival. int.type string specifying type integration method prediction error curves. Either 'unweighted' 'weighted'.

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
text: predErr returns object class survErr. Specifically, predErr returns list containing following components: error prediction error estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points prediction errors evaluated. ierror integrated prediction error.

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
text: function implements two types prediction error curves right-censored time--event data: Brier Score (type = "brier", Gerds Schumacher 2006) estimates squared deviation predicted observed survival whereas method proposed Schmid et al. (2011) estimates absolute deviation predicted observed survival (type = "robust"). methods based inverse-probability--censoring weights assume specific working model survival prediction.  Note, however, estimators implemented predErr, restricted situations random censoring assumption holds. Time-independent summary measures prediction error given areas prediction error curves. int.type = "weighted", prediction errors weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome.

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr
text: Gerds, T. . M. Schumacher (2006). Consistent estimation expected Brier score general survival models right-censored event times.Biometrical Journal 48, 1029–1040. Schmid, M., T. Hielscher, T. Augustin, O. Gefeller (2011). robust alter- native Schemper-Henderson estimator prediction error.Biometrics 67, 524–535.

title: Distance-based estimators of survival predictive accuracy — predErr

code: schemper(train.fit, traindata, newdata)

title: Distance-based estimator of survival predictive accuracy proposed by Schemper and Henderson — schemper
text: train.fit cph object containing fit Cox proportional hazards model. traindata data frame containing set training data. newdata data frame containing set test data.

title: Distance-based estimator of survival predictive accuracy proposed by Schemper and Henderson — schemper
text: code adapted Lusa et al. (2007). Schemper Henderson's estimator (implemented Lusa et al. 2007) assumes predictions time--event outcome obtained Cox proportional hazards model. estimator valid long Cox model specified correctly. Technical details: Cox model estimated via cph function         Design package. survival times censoring indicators         labelled “time” “status”, respectively (see example ). contrast estimators implemented survAUC package,         schemper estimate survival function censoring distribution         training data test data. details estimator implementation, refer Schemper Henderson (2000) Lusa et al. (2007).

title: Distance-based estimator of survival predictive accuracy proposed by Schemper and Henderson — schemper
text: schemper returns list following components: Model call cph. D estimator predictive accuracy obtained            covariate-free null model. Dx estimator predictive accuracy obtained             Cox model. V estimator relative gains predictive accuracy. Mhat absolute distance estimator obtained               Cox model (evaluated event times test data). Mhat.0 absolute distance estimator obtained               covariate-free null model (evaluated event times               test data). timep event times test data.

title: Distance-based estimator of survival predictive accuracy proposed by Schemper and Henderson — schemper
text: Schemper, M. R. Henderson (2000). Predictive accuracy explained variation Cox regression.Biometrics 56, 249–255. Lusa, L., R. Miceli L. Mariani (2007). Estimation predictive accuracy survival analysis using R S-PLUS.Computer Methods Programms Biomedicine 87, 132–137.

title: Distance-based estimator of survival predictive accuracy proposed by Schemper and Henderson — schemper
code: data(cancer,package="survival") ovarian$time <- ovarian$futime ovarian$status <- ovarian$fustat set.seed(2011) trobs <- sample(1:26,16) TR <- ovarian[trobs,] TE <- ovarian[-trobs,] train.fit  <- rms::cph(survival::Surv(time, status) ~ age,                   x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  schemper(train.fit, TR, TE) #> $Model #> rms::cph(formula = survival::Surv(time, status) ~ age, data = TR,  #>     method = "breslow", x = TRUE, y = TRUE) #>  #> $D #> [1] 0.3460938 #>  #> $Dx #> [1] 0.3169285 #>  #> $V #> [1] 0.0842697 #>  #> $Mhat #> [1] 0.4213731 0.3293749 0.2482184 0.2994786 0.2930806 #>  #> $Mhat.0 #> [1] 0.1000 0.2375 0.4000 0.4500 0.5000 #>  #> $timep #> [1]  59 156 365 431 464 #>

(2007).

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — survAUC_ChamDiao
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — survAUC_ChamDiao
text: AUC.cd returns object class survAUC. Specifically, AUC.cd returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic AUC estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — survAUC_ChamDiao
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed Section 3.3 Chambless Diao (2006). contrast general form Chambless Diao's estimator, AUC.cd restricted Cox regression.  Specifically, assumed lp lpnew predictors Cox proportional hazards model. Estimates obtained AUC.cd valid long Cox model specified correctly. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). Note recursive estimators proposed Sections 3.1 3.2 Chambless Diao (2006) implemented survAUC package.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — survAUC_ChamDiao
text: Chambless, L. E. G. Diao (2006).  Estimation time-dependent area ROC curve long-term risk prediction.Statistics Medicine 25, 3474–3486.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Chambless and Diao — survAUC_ChamDiao
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                    AUC_CD <- AUC.cd(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times)

title: AUC estimator proposed by Hung and Chiang — survAUC_HungChiang
text: function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC proposed Hung Chiang (2010). estimator based inverse-probability--censoring weights assume specific working model deriving predictor lpnew. assumed, however, one--one relationship predictor expected survival times conditional predictor. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). Note estimator implemented AUC.hc restricted situations random censoring assumption holds (formula (4) Hung Chiang 2010).

code: sens.sh(Surv.rsp, lp, lpnew, times, type = "incident")  spec.sh(Surv.rsp, lp, lpnew, times)  AUC.sh(   Surv.rsp,   Surv.rsp.new = NULL,   lp,   lpnew,   times,   type = "incident",   savesensspec = FALSE )

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — survAUC_SongZhou
text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. lp vector predictors estimated training data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC. type string defining type true positive rate (TPR): "incident" refers incident TPR , "cumulative" refers cumulative TPR. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. savesensspec logical specifying whether sensitivities specificities saved.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — survAUC_SongZhou
text: AUC.sh returns object class survAUC. Specifically, AUC.sh returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic incident/dynamic AUC estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC. sens.sh spec.sh return matrices dimensions times x lpnew + 1. elements matrices sensitivity specificity estimates threshold lpnew time point specified times.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — survAUC_SongZhou
text: sens.sh spec.sh functions implement estimators time-dependent true false positive rates proposed Song Zhou (2008). AUC.sh function implements estimators cumulative/dynamic incident/dynamic AUC proposed Song Zhou (2008). estimators given areas time-dependent ROC curves estimated sens.sh spec.sh. case cumulative/dynamic AUC, iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). case incident/dynamic AUC, iauc given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted 2 times product estimated probability density estimated survival function time--event outcome). results obtained spec.sh, spec.sh AUC.sh valid long lp lpnew predictors correctly specified Cox proportional hazards model. case, estimators remain valid even censoring times depend values predictors.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — survAUC_SongZhou
text: Song, X. X.-H. Zhou (2008). semiparametric approach covariate specific ROC curve survival outcome.Statistica Sinica 18, 947–965.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Song and Zhou — survAUC_SongZhou
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lp <- predict(train.fit) lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                    AUC_sh <- AUC.sh(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lp, lpnew, times) names(AUC_sh) #> [1] "auc"   "times" "iauc"  AUC_sh$iauc #> [1] 0.8430845

text: Surv.rsp Surv(.,.) object containing outcome training data. Surv.rsp.new Surv(.,.) object containing outcome test data. lpnew vector predictors obtained test data. times vector time points evaluate AUC. savesensspec logical specifying whether sensitivities specificities saved.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Uno et al. — survAUC_Uno
text: AUC.uno returns object class survAUC. Specifically, AUC.uno returns list following components: auc cumulative/dynamic AUC estimates (evaluated times). times vector time points AUC evaluated. iauc summary measure AUC. sens.uno spec.uno return matrices dimensions times x (lpnew + 1). elements matrices sensitivity specificity estimates threshold lpnew time point specified times.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Uno et al. — survAUC_Uno
text: sens.uno spec.uno functions implement estimators time-dependent true false positive rates proposed Section 5.1 Uno et al. (2007). AUC.uno function implements estimator cumulative/dynamic AUC based TPR FPR estimators proposed Uno et al. (2007). given area(s) time-dependent ROC curve(s) estimated sens.uno spec.uno. iauc summary measure given integral AUC [0, max(times)] (weighted estimated probability density time--event outcome). Uno's estimators based inverse-probability--censoring weights assume specific working model deriving predictor lpnew. assumed, however, one--one relationship predictor expected survival times conditional predictor. Note estimators implemented sens.uno, spec.uno AUC.uno restricted situations random censoring assumption holds.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Uno et al. — survAUC_Uno
text: Uno, H., T. Cai, L. Tian, L. J. Wei (2007). Evaluating prediction rules t-year survivors censored regression models.Journal American Statistical Association 102, 527–537.

title: AUC estimator proposed by Uno et al. — survAUC_Uno
code: data(cancer,package="survival") TR <- ovarian[1:16,] TE <- ovarian[17:26,] train.fit  <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(futime, fustat) ~ age,                     x=TRUE, y=TRUE, method="breslow", data=TR)  lpnew <- predict(train.fit, newdata=TE) Surv.rsp <- survival::Surv(TR$futime, TR$fustat) Surv.rsp.new <- survival::Surv(TE$futime, TE$fustat) times <- seq(10, 1000, 10)                    AUC_Uno <- AUC.uno(Surv.rsp, Surv.rsp.new, lpnew, times) names(AUC_Uno) #> [1] "auc"   "times" "iauc"  AUC_Uno$iauc #> [1] 0.7552083
